title: Authors and Citation
text: Akiru Kato. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Kato (2025). baritsu: Wrappers 'mlpack'. R package version 0.0.2, https://paithiov909.github.io/baritsu/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {baritsu: Wrappers for 'mlpack'},   author = {Akiru Kato},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.0.2},   url = {https://paithiov909.github.io/baritsu/}, }

title: Wrappers for mlpack
text: main goal baritsu implement wrappers mlpack allows formula argument. Also, baritsu provides parsnip engines wrappers, can used tidymodels workflows.

title: Wrappers for mlpack
text: can install development version baritsu GitHub :

title: Wrappers for mlpack
text: basic example shows solve common problem:
code: suppressPackageStartupMessages({   require(tidymodels)   require(baritsu) })  data("penguins", package = "modeldata")  set.seed(1218) data_split <- initial_split(penguins, strata = species) penguins_train <- training(data_split) penguins_test <- testing(data_split)  rec <-   recipe(     species ~ .,     data = penguins_train   ) |>   step_impute_median(all_numeric_predictors()) |>   step_impute_mode(all_nominal_predictors())  spec <-   decision_tree(     tree_depth = 0,     min_n = 5   ) |>   set_engine("baritsu") |>   set_mode("classification")  translate(spec) #> Decision Tree Model Specification (classification) #>  #> Main Arguments: #>   tree_depth = 0 #>   min_n = 5 #>  #> Computational engine: baritsu  #>  #> Model fit template: #> baritsu::decision_trees(formula = missing_arg(), data = missing_arg(),  #>     x = missing_arg(), y = missing_arg(), tree_depth = 0, min_n = 5)  wf_fit <- workflow() |>   add_recipe(rec) |>   add_model(spec) |>   fit(penguins_train)  pred <- augment(wf_fit, penguins_test) |>   dplyr::select(species, .pred_class)  pred #> # A tibble: 86 × 2 #>    species .pred_class #>    <fct>   <fct>       #>  1 Adelie  Adelie      #>  2 Adelie  Adelie      #>  3 Adelie  Adelie      #>  4 Adelie  Adelie      #>  5 Adelie  Adelie      #>  6 Adelie  Adelie      #>  7 Adelie  Adelie      #>  8 Adelie  Adelie      #>  9 Adelie  Adelie      #> 10 Adelie  Adelie      #> # ℹ 76 more rows  f_meas(pred, truth = species, estimate = .pred_class) #> # A tibble: 1 × 3 #>   .metric .estimator .estimate #>   <chr>   <chr>          <dbl> #> 1 f_meas  macro          0.957

title: AdaBoost — adaboost
text: wrapper around mlpack::adaboost() allows passing formula.

title: AdaBoost — adaboost
code: adaboost(   formula = NULL,   data = NULL,   epochs = 1000,   tolerance = 1e-10,   weak_learner = c("decision_stump", "perceptron"),   x = NULL,   y = NULL )

title: AdaBoost — adaboost
text: formula formula. data data.frame. epochs maximum number boosting iterations run (0 run convergence.) tolerance tolerance change values weighted error training. weak_learner Weak learner use. Either "decision_stump" "perceptron". x Design matrix. y Response matrix.

title: AdaBoost — adaboost
text: object class baritsu_ab.

title: baritsu: Wrappers for 'mlpack' — baritsu-package
text: collection wrappers 'mlpack' package allows passing formula argument.

title: baritsu: Wrappers for 'mlpack' — baritsu-package
text: Maintainer: Akiru Kato paithiov909@gmail.com

title: Decision trees — decision_trees
text: wrapper around mlpack::decision_tree() allows passing formula.

title: Decision trees — decision_trees
code: decision_trees(   formula = NULL,   data = NULL,   tree_depth = 0,   min_n = 20,   minimum_gain_split = 1e-07,   weights = NULL,   x = NULL,   y = NULL )

title: Decision trees — decision_trees
text: formula formula. data data.frame. tree_depth Maximum depth tree. min_n Minimum number data points leaf. minimum_gain_split Minimum gain required split internal node. weights Weights observation. x Design matrix. y Response matrix.

title: Decision trees — decision_trees
text: object class baritsu_dt.

title: Decision trees — decision_trees
text: prevent masking parsnip::decision_tree(), function named decision_trees (plural form!)

title: AdaBoost via baritsu — details_boost_tree_baritsu
text: mlpack::adaboost() implementation AdaBoost.MH (Adaptive Boosting) algorithm classification.

title: AdaBoost via baritsu — details_boost_tree_baritsu
text: engine, single mode: classification

title: AdaBoost via baritsu — details_boost_tree_baritsu
text: model tuning parameters.

title: Decision trees via baritsu — details_decision_tree_baritsu
text: mlpack::decision_tree() implementation ID3-style decision tree classification, supports categorical data.

title: Decision trees via baritsu — details_decision_tree_baritsu
text: engine, single mode: classification

title: Decision trees via baritsu — details_decision_tree_baritsu
text: model 2 tuning parameters: tree_depth: Tree depth (type: integer) min_n: Minimal Node Size (type: integer)

title: Hoeffding trees via baritsu — hoeffding_tree
text: hoeffding_tree() defines Hoeffding tree model.

title: Hoeffding trees via baritsu — hoeffding_tree
code: hoeffding_tree(   mode = "classification",   engine = "baritsu",   confidence_factor = NULL,   sample_size = NULL )

title: Hoeffding trees via baritsu — hoeffding_tree
text: mode single character string type model. possible value model "classification". engine single character string specifying computational engine use fitting. confidence_factor Confidence splitting. sample_size Number passes take dataset.

title: Hoeffding trees via baritsu — hoeffding_tree
text: model, single mode: classification

title: Hoeffding trees via baritsu — hoeffding_tree
text: model 2 tuning parameters: confidence_factor: Confidence splitting (type: double) sample_size: Number passes take dataset (type: int)

title: Least angle regression — lars
text: lars() defines model can predict numeric values predictors using linear_regression(), wrapper mlpack::lars(). mlpack::lars() implementation Least Angle Regression (Stagewise/laSso), also known LARS.

title: Least angle regression — lars
code: lars(   mode = "regression",   engine = "baritsu",   penalty_L1 = NULL,   penalty_L2 = NULL )

title: Least angle regression — lars
text: mode single character string type model. possible value model "regression". engine single character string specifying computational engine use fitting. penalty_L1 Regularization parameter L1-norm penalty. penalty_L2 Regularization parameter L2-norm penalty.

title: Least angle regression — lars
text: model, single mode: regression

title: Least angle regression — lars
text: model 2 tuning parameters: penalty_L1 Amount regularization Lasso Penalty (type: double) penalty_L2 Amount regularization Ridge Penalty (type: double)

title: Logistic regression via baritsu — details_logistic_reg_baritsu
text: mlpack::logistic_regression() implementation L2-regularized logistic regression two-class classification.

title: Logistic regression via baritsu — details_logistic_reg_baritsu
text: engine, single mode: classification

title: Logistic regression via baritsu — details_logistic_reg_baritsu
text: model 1 tuning parameter: penalty: Amount regularization (type: double)

text: engine, single mode: classification

text: model 1 tuning parameter: penalty: Amount Regularization (type: double)

text: engine, single mode: classification

text: engine, single mode: classification

title: Hoeffding trees — hoeffding_trees
text: wrapper around mlpack::hoeffding_tree() allows passing formula.

title: Hoeffding trees — hoeffding_trees
code: hoeffding_trees(   formula = NULL,   data = NULL,   confidence_factor = 0.95,   sample_size = 10,   max_samples = 5000,   min_samples = 100,   info_gain = FALSE,   batch_mode = FALSE,   numeric_split_strategy = c("binary", "domingos"),   num_breaks = 10,   observations_before_binning = 100,   x = NULL,   y = NULL )

title: Hoeffding trees — hoeffding_trees
text: formula formula. data data.frame. confidence_factor Confidence splitting (0 1). sample_size Number passes take dataset. max_samples Maximum number samples splitting. min_samples Minimum number samples splitting. info_gain Logical. set, information gain used instead Gini impurity calculating Hoeffding bounds. batch_mode Logical. true, samples considered batch instead stream. generally results better trees cost memory usage runtime. numeric_split_strategy splitting strategy use numeric features. num_breaks "domingos" split strategy used, specifies number bins numeric split. observations_before_binning "domingos" split strategy used, specifies number samples observed binning performed. x Design matrix. y Response matrix.

title: Hoeffding trees — hoeffding_trees
text: object class baritsu_ht.

title: Linear regression — linear_regression
text: wrapper around mlpack::linear_regression() mlpack::lars() allows passing formula.

title: Linear regression — linear_regression
code: linear_regression(   formula = NULL,   data = NULL,   lambda1 = 0,   lambda2 = 0,   no_intercept = FALSE,   no_normalize = FALSE,   use_cholesky = FALSE,   x = NULL,   y = NULL )

title: Linear regression — linear_regression
text: formula formula. data data.frame. lambda1 Regularization parameter L1-norm penalty. lambda2 Regularization parameter L2-norm penalty. no_intercept Logical; passed mlpack::lars(). no_normalize Logical; passed mlpack::lars(). use_cholesky Logical; passed mlpack::lars(). x Design matrix. y Response matrix.

title: Linear regression — linear_regression
text: object class baritsu_lr.

title: Linear regression — linear_regression
text: lambda1 0, function fallbacks mlpack::linear_regression() performance.

text: wrapper around mlpack::bayesian_linear_regression() allows passing formula.

title: Bayesian linear regression — linear_regression_bayesian
code: linear_regression_bayesian(   formula = NULL,   data = NULL,   center = FALSE,   scale = FALSE,   x = NULL,   y = NULL )

title: Bayesian linear regression — linear_regression_bayesian
text: formula formula. data data.frame. center Logical; enabled, centers data fits intercept. scale Logical; enabled, scales feature standard deviations. x Design matrix. y Response matrix.

title: Bayesian linear regression — linear_regression_bayesian
text: object class baritsu_blr.

title: L2-regularized support vector machine — linear_svm
text: wrapper around mlpack::linear_svm() allows passing formula.

title: L2-regularized support vector machine — linear_svm
code: linear_svm(   formula = NULL,   data = NULL,   margin = 1,   penalty = 1e-04,   epochs = 1000,   no_intercept = FALSE,   tolerance = 1e-10,   optimizer = c("lbfgs", "psgd"),   stop_iter = 50,   learn_rate = 0.01,   shuffle = FALSE,   seed = 0,   x = NULL,   y = NULL )

title: L2-regularized support vector machine — linear_svm
text: formula formula. data data.frame. margin Margin difference correct class classes. penalty L2-regularization constant. epochs Maximum iterations optimizer (0 indicates limit). argument passed max_iterations, epochs mlpack::linear_svm(). no_intercept Logical; passed mlpack::linear_svm(). tolerance Convergence tolerance optimizer. optimizer Optimizer use training ("lbfgs" "psgd"). stop_iter Maximum number full epochs dataset parallel SGD. learn_rate Step size parallel SGD optimizer. data points visited parallel SGD. shuffle Logical; true, shuffle order. seed Random seed. 0, std::time(NULL) used internally. x Design matrix. y Response matrix.

title: L2-regularized support vector machine — linear_svm
text: object class baritsu_svm.

title: L2-regularized logistic regression — logistic_regression
text: wrapper around mlpack::logistic_regression() allows passing formula.

title: L2-regularized logistic regression — logistic_regression
code: logistic_regression(   formula = NULL,   data = NULL,   penalty = 1e-04,   epochs = 1000,   decision_boundary = 0.5,   tolerance = 1e-10,   optimizer = c("lbfgs", "sgd"),   batch_size = 64,   learn_rate = 0.01,   x = NULL,   y = NULL )

title: L2-regularized logistic regression — logistic_regression
text: formula formula. data data.frame. penalty L2-regularization constant. epochs Maximum number iterations. decision_boundary Decision boundary prediction; logistic function point less boundary, class taken 0; otherwise, class 1. tolerance Convergence tolerance optimizer. optimizer Optimizer use training ("lbfgs" "sgd"). batch_size Batch size SGD. learn_rate Step size SGD optimizer. x Design matrix. y Response matrix.

title: L2-regularized logistic regression — logistic_regression
text: object class baritsu_lgr.

what: Prediction using mlpack via baritsu — predict.baritsu
title: Prediction using mlpack via baritsu — predict.baritsu
text: Predicts new data using stored mlpack model.

title: Prediction using mlpack via baritsu — predict.baritsu
code: # S3 method for class 'baritsu_ab' predict(object, newdata, type = c("both", "class", "prob"), ...)  # S3 method for class 'baritsu_dt' predict(object, newdata, type = c("both", "class", "prob"), ...)  # S3 method for class 'baritsu_ht' predict(object, newdata, ...)  # S3 method for class 'baritsu_blr' predict(object, newdata, ...)  # S3 method for class 'baritsu_lr' predict(object, newdata, ...)  # S3 method for class 'baritsu_lgr' predict(object, newdata, type = c("both", "class", "prob"), ...)  # S3 method for class 'baritsu_prc' predict(object, newdata, ...)  # S3 method for class 'baritsu_sr' predict(object, newdata, type = c("both", "class", "prob"), ...)  # S3 method for class 'baritsu_nbc' predict(object, newdata, type = c("both", "class", "prob"), ...)  # S3 method for class 'baritsu_rf' predict(object, newdata, type = c("both", "class", "prob"), ...)  # S3 method for class 'baritsu_svm' predict(object, newdata, type = c("both", "class", "prob"), ...)

title: Prediction using mlpack via baritsu — predict.baritsu
text: object object baritsu function. newdata data.frame. type Type prediction. One "", "class", "prob". ... used.

title: Prediction using mlpack via baritsu — predict.baritsu
text: tibble contains predictions /probabilities (also standard deviations predictive distribution predict.baritsu_blr).

title: Random forests — random_forest
text: wrapper around mlpack::random_forest() allows passing formula.

title: Random forests — random_forest
code: random_forest(   formula = NULL,   data = NULL,   mtry = 0,   trees = 10,   min_n = 1,   maximum_depth = 0,   minimum_gain_split = 0,   seed = 0,   x = NULL,   y = NULL )

title: Random forests — random_forest
text: formula formula. data data.frame. mtry Subspace dimension. 0, autoselects square root data dimensionality. trees Number trees. min_n Minimum number data points leaf. maximum_depth Maximum depth tree. minimum_gain_split Minimum gain required split internal node. seed Random seed. 0, std::time(NULL) used internally. x Design matrix. y Response matrix.

title: Random forests — random_forest
text: object class baritsu_rf.
